Params: Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory172.png
Echo
Phew...
Echo
I never thought I'd end up at an event like this. Thanks for inviting me, Commandant... uh...
You struggle to signal Echo from within the shopping bags that you are okay, but she looks troubled and quickly steps in to help carry two of them.
Even though she's got her hands full, her armor decked out like a Christmas tree.
Echo
I'm sorry, Commandant. I should've been more controlled...
No worries.
This shopping street is seriously tempting, though.
Echo
But... I've pretty much blown through all the coins we busted our butts to earn together, Commandant...
Spending money seems to be the "rule" of this place.
You motion for Echo to check out the sign at the entrance of the commercial street, which clearly lays out several "Guidelines".
Echo
But still... what I did back there was kind of rude. Sorry about that.
Echo struggles a bit, nearly dropping the shopping bags, as she performs a fancy apology gesture.
Let's put these bags down over there for now.
There is a nearby square where we can take a load off.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory252.png
After you drop the bags, Echo settles down gracefully, checking out the whole scene of the commercial street.
Echo
Valentine's Day... I never knew about these festivals before. This is way cooler than I expected.
But wait, there's more.
(You quickly fill Echo in on the story and poems behind these lovers' days in the Golden Age.)
Echo
Ah, now it all makes sense... No wonder the coins have those magpie designs.
Echo
Beneath faint moon, vast sky tranquil, Milky Way aligns, eternal... Those Kowloong verses are something else. I gotta jot them down before I forget.
Echo
Love, enduring time's vast stages, dawn to dusk, mere fleeting pages...
Echo
The poetry of Kowloong... it's just captivating, isn't it?
She recites the verses with grace, from the majestic to the simple. It takes a while before Echo finally stops writing.
Echo
Ah! Sorry about that... l lost track of time and kept you waiting, Commandant.
No worries.
Well, then you'll just have to make it up to me.
Echo
Hmm... maybe this will make up for it, Commandant.
She digs into the shopping bag at her feet. With a flourish, she presents a beautifully wrapped box containing a pen adorned with a galaxy pattern.
Echo

I spotted this in a shop over there and thought it was just perfect for you, Commandant. And I paired it with this notebook, featuring a row of magpies, just like the "Bridge of Magpies" you mentioned.
Echo
And these pendants shaped like birds and clouds. They'd look great hanging on your personal terminal or in your room. And...
The pile of gifts meant for you keeps growing as Echo's shopping bags empty out.
Wait, all these for me? Seriously?
There's so much!
Echo
Yep, every bit of it. These are all things I thought would be perfect for you, Commandant.
Echo
And these... are for my sister.
After distributing the gifts, only one bag remains on the ground.
Wait, did you only get this one for yourself?
Echo
Yes, I didn't really see anything else I needed.
Echo
I never imagined I'd be doing something like this before. This place is really something...
Echo relaxes her usually stiff posture.
Now it's my turn to give you a gift.
(Pull out a book that's been tucked away in your pocket for a while)
Echo
This is... a collection of Kowloong poetry! Amazing!
I'm glad you like it.
Getting this wasn't a walk in the park.
Echo
Thank you, Commandant! I really like it!
Silently, Echo's armor sidles up from the side, leaving behind a gift for her.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory783.jpg
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory783.jpg
With the sun sinking low, the fading light marks the end of today's adventures.
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory252.png
Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory252.png
Echo
If only today lasts forever...
So, what's the plan for tomorrow?
Echo
My calendar says we're hitting up another conservation area...
Echo
It means I'll be away from you for a bit again, Commandant.
Echo
But hey, no biggie.
Echo
After all... Dawn to dusk, mere fleeting pages, right?
In the fading light, she flashes a gentle smile.
(Smile)
Yeah, that's right.
Echo
W-what's with that grin? Don't tell me... this poem isn't saying what I think it is?
Echo
Oh, come on... quit laughing!...
Echo
Alright!
